Beginner Level.name: Neck Rolls (30 sec each side)
Beginner Level.how_to: Sit upright. Drop your chin slightly toward your chest. Gently roll your head clockwise in a full circle for 30 seconds, then counterclockwise.
Beginner Level.common_mistakes: Rolling too fast or tilting head too far back.
Beginner Level.tips: Keep movements slow and controlled. Focus on loosening tension.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Do 30 seconds per direction, 2--3 times per day (especially after long screen work).
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Neck Rolls are a gentle, circular movement of the head and neck that helps stretch and loosen the muscles in the neck, shoulders, and upper spine. This exercise releases built-up tension caused by prolonged sitting, screen time, or bad posture, which is very common for office workers. It improves neck mobility, reduces stiffness, relieves tension headaches, and prevents upper back and shoulder pain.

Beginner Level.name: Shoulder Shrugs (2 sets of 15 reps)
Beginner Level.how_to: Raise your shoulders toward your ears, hold 1 second, then slowly release down.
Beginner Level.common_mistakes: Jerky, fast movements or rotating shoulders aggressively.
Beginner Level.tips: Exhale while lowering shoulders. Feel the release in the upper back.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Do 2 sets of 15 reps during a short break. Best done every 2--3 hours if sitting long hours.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Shoulder Shrugs are a simple but effective exercise designed to strengthen the upper trapezius muscles and relieve tension in the shoulders and neck --- areas that become stiff from long hours of sitting, typing, or computer work. This move improves posture, reduces neck pain, prevents shoulder stiffness, and boosts blood flow to the upper body.

Beginner Level.name: Seated Leg Extensions (2 sets of 15 reps per leg)
Beginner Level.how_to: Sit upright, extend one leg forward until it's straight, pause briefly, lower down. Alternate legs.
Beginner Level.common_mistakes: Slouching or swinging legs too fast.
Beginner Level.tips: Engage your thigh muscle when lifting. Move smoothly.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Ideally perform 2--3 times a day if you are sitting for extended hours.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Seated Leg Extensions are a simple but powerful exercise that primarily targets your quadriceps --- the large muscles at the front of your thighs. They are ideal for activating your legs and improving knee joint mobility while sitting at a desk.

Beginner Level.name: Wrist and Forearm Stretches (30 sec per side)
Beginner Level.how_to: Extend one arm forward, palm facing down. Gently pull fingers back with the other hand.
Beginner Level.tips: Only stretch until you feel a light tension, not pain.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Hold each stretch for 30 seconds per side. Repeat 2--3 times daily, especially after long typing sessions.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Wrist and Forearm Stretches are essential stretches designed to improve flexibility and reduce tightness in the wrists, hands, and forearms --- especially important for people who spend long hours typing, writing, or using a mouse.

Beginner Level.name: Seated Side Stretch (30 sec per side)
Beginner Level.how_to: Sit tall. Reach one arm overhead and lean gently to the opposite side.
Beginner Level.tips: Keep both hips grounded. Stretch directly to the side.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Hold for 30 seconds per side. Repeat 2--3 times per day, especially after prolonged sitting or during work breaks.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: The Seated Side Stretch is a simple yet powerful stretch that elongates the muscles along the sides of the body, improves spinal mobility, and relieves tension built up from sitting long hours.

Beginner Level.name: Ankle Rolls (20 seconds each foot)
Beginner Level.how_to: Circle your ankles clockwise and counterclockwise.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Perform 20 seconds per foot at least 2--3 times a day --- especially after sitting for more than 1 hour.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Ankle Rolls are a gentle and effective mobility exercise designed to increase flexibility, improve joint health, and stimulate blood circulation in the lower legs and feet.

Beginner Level.name: Seated Marching (1 minute)
Beginner Level.how_to: March in place while sitting, lifting knees high.
Beginner Level.common_mistakes: Slouching or very tiny leg lifts.
Beginner Level.tips: Engage core muscles. Lift knees high for a better burn.
Beginner Level.time_recommendation: Perform 1 minute of Seated Marching every hour of prolonged sitting to maintain blood flow and energy levels.
Beginner Level.detailed_description: Seated Marching is an easy and effective cardio-style exercise performed while sitting. It mimics the action of marching but while remaining seated, making it a low-impact and joint-friendly way to increase heart rate, activate leg muscles, and boost blood circulation.

Intermediate Level.name: Seated Marches (2 sets of 30 seconds)
Intermediate Level.how_to: March your legs up and down while sitting, as if "jogging" in place.
Intermediate Level.common_mistakes: Slouching or very tiny leg lifts.
Intermediate Level.tips: Engage core muscles. Lift knees high for a better burn.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds during a short desk break. Repeat 2--3 times per day to stay active during long workdays.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Seated Marches are an energetic, low-impact exercise that mimics the movement of jogging while sitting. It activates your hip flexors, engages your core muscles, and improves lower body circulation, making it perfect for maintaining fitness during long periods of sitting.

Intermediate Level.name: Standing Calf Raises (2 sets of 20 reps)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Stand behind your chair or desk. Raise heels off the ground, then lower slowly.
Intermediate Level.tips: Pause 1 second at the top of the lift for maximum calf engagement.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 2 sets of 20 reps during daily standing breaks or workouts. Can be added multiple times per day for better calf endurance.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Standing Calf Raises are a simple but highly effective exercise designed to strengthen the calves, improve balance, and enhance lower body endurance.

Intermediate Level.name: Desk Push-ups (2 sets of 12--15 reps)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Place hands shoulder-width apart on desk. Lower chest toward desk, keeping body straight. Push back up.
Intermediate Level.common_mistakes: Sagging hips or bending at the hips.
Intermediate Level.tips: Tighten your core during the entire movement. Keep a straight line from head to heel.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 2 sets of 12--15 reps during quick daily workout breaks.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Desk Push-ups are a modified push-up variation that uses a desk, sturdy table, or counter for support instead of the floor. They are a fantastic option for building upper body strength, toning muscles, and engaging the core.

Intermediate Level.name: Standing Hamstring Stretch (30 sec per leg)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Place one heel on the floor a little in front of you, bend at hips (not back), lean slightly forward.
Intermediate Level.tips: Keep spine long, bend from hips, not the lower back.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Hold each leg for 30 seconds. Repeat 2--3 times daily, especially after periods of sitting or lower body workouts.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: The Standing Hamstring Stretch is a fundamental flexibility exercise that elongates the muscles at the back of the thighs and loosens up the lower back.

Intermediate Level.name: Torso Twists (2 sets of 15 reps)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Sit tall, arms crossed over chest, twist your torso left, then right.
Intermediate Level.common_mistakes: Moving arms only (instead of twisting your full torso).
Intermediate Level.tips: Keep hips stable --- only your torso should rotate.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 2 sets of 15 reps during a short stretching break. Can be included in morning mobility routines or pre-workout warmups.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Torso Twists are a controlled rotational movement that helps strengthen the obliques and improve spinal mobility. This movement is essential for maintaining a healthy, flexible spine and enhancing core stability.

Intermediate Level.name: Arm Circles (30 sec forward + 30 sec backward)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Extend arms out to sides, make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward.
Intermediate Level.tips: Keep shoulders relaxed and circles small but controlled.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 30 seconds forward + 30 seconds backward = 1-minute set. Can be done multiple times a day --- great before workouts or after long sitting periods.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Arm Circles are a simple yet effective bodyweight exercise designed to increase shoulder mobility, strengthen the deltoids, and warm up the upper body.

Intermediate Level.name: Seated Knee Lifts with Core Squeeze (2 sets of 20 reps)
Intermediate Level.how_to: Sit back slightly, lift both knees toward chest, squeeze abs, lower slowly.
Intermediate Level.tips: Move slowly, feel abs tightening during lift.
Intermediate Level.time_recommendation: Perform 2 sets of 20 reps daily or every alternate day for best core strength improvement.
Intermediate Level.detailed_description: Seated Knee Lifts with Core Squeeze are a powerful seated core exercise designed to activate the lower abdominal muscles, strengthen the hip flexors, and improve balance and posture --- all without needing to lie on the floor.

Advanced Level.name: Chair Squats (3 sets of 15 reps)
Advanced Level.how_to: Stand in front of a chair. Lower hips back and down (as if sitting), then stand back up.
Advanced Level.common_mistakes: Knees moving too far forward over toes.
Advanced Level.tips: Push hips back like sitting in a chair. Keep knees behind toes.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 3--4x weekly (pair with upper-body or core exercises).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Chair Squats are a foundational lower-body exercise that builds strength, mobility, and control in the hips and legs while minimizing knee strain.

Advanced Level.name: Standing Lunges (Desk Support) (2 sets of 10 each leg)
Advanced Level.how_to: Step one leg forward, lower hips down until both knees at 90Â°, push back to start.
Advanced Level.tips: Keep torso upright, step far enough forward.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 3x weekly (pair with chair squats for a full lower-body workout).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Standing Lunges with desk support are a functional lower-body exercise that builds unilateral (single-leg) strength, improves balance, and enhances hip flexibility.

Advanced Level.name: Desk Tricep Dips (2 sets of 12 reps)
Advanced Level.how_to: Hands on desk edge, fingers pointing forward, lower body down by bending elbows, push up.
Advanced Level.common_mistakes: Shoulders hunching or elbows flaring out.
Advanced Level.tips: Keep elbows tucked in close to your body.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 2--3x weekly (pair with bicep curls or push-ups for balanced arms).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Desk Tricep Dips are a bodyweight compound movement that isolates the triceps while engaging the shoulders and core for stability.

Advanced Level.name: High Knees (Standing) (2 rounds of 30 seconds)
Advanced Level.how_to: Jog in place lifting knees toward chest.
Advanced Level.tips: Pump arms for higher heart rate.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 3--5x weekly (as part of warm-ups or cardio circuits).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Standing High Knees are a dynamic cardio exercise that elevates heart rate while engaging the core and lower body.

Advanced Level.name: Seated Bicycle Crunches (2 sets of 20 reps)
Advanced Level.how_to: Sit back slightly, hands behind head, bring opposite knee and elbow toward each other in a twisting motion.
Advanced Level.tips: Focus on slow and controlled twisting from the waist.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 3--4x weekly (pair with planks for balanced core development).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Seated Bicycle Crunches are a zero-equipment core crusher that combines rotation and flexion to target stubborn obliques while improving posture and spinal mobility.

Advanced Level.name: Desk Plank Hold (30--45 seconds)
Advanced Level.how_to: Place forearms or hands on desk, step back to form straight body line, hold.
Advanced Level.common_mistakes: Sagging hips or lifting hips too high.
Advanced Level.tips: Engage your abs and glutes, hold firm like a plank of wood.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: Daily (3--5 holds spread through the workday).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: The Desk Plank is a static, full-body engagement exercise that builds core stability, shoulder endurance, and postural alignment---all while using your office furniture.

Advanced Level.name: Standing Side Kicks (20 per side)
Advanced Level.how_to: Stand tall, lift one leg sideways, then return.
Advanced Level.tips: Keep torso upright and kick slowly to feel glute engagement.
Advanced Level.time_recommendation: 3-4x weekly (pair with squats for balanced glute development).
Advanced Level.detailed_description: Standing Side Kicks are a unilateral, low-impact exercise that targets the often-neglected gluteus medius---critical for hip stability, injury prevention, and achieving a sculpted lower body.
